message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a novel semi-supervised dictionary learning and sparse representation algorithm for classification tasks. This algorithm involves learning the dictionary in a space where the dependency between the data and class labels is maximized using Hilbert-Schmidt independence criterion (HSIC). This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG) or computer vision (cs.CV). Additionally, the paper involves experiments on benchmark datasets, which suggests that it could also belong to the sub-categories of artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computational linguistics (cs.CL), or neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE).
